TypeSignature.Value: .class public sequential ansi beforefieldinit SayAs extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Contains information about the content type (such as currency, date, or address) or language construct that determine how text should be spoken.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Creates a new instance of the SayAs class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The properties of the <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.SayAs> class are used to get or set the values for the attributes of the `say-as` element in SSML markup. The <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.FragmentState.SayAs%2A> property uses a <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.SayAs> instance to inform the <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.SpeechSynthesizer> how to speak the text contained in the <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.TextFragment.TextToSpeak%2A> property of a <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.TextFragment>.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.FragmentState.SayAs%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property gets or sets the value for the <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.SayAs.Detail%2A> property in a <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.SayAs> instance.

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the value of the format attribute for a say-as element in the SSML markup language of a prompt.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.FragmentState.SayAs%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property gets or sets the value for the <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.SayAs.Format%2A> property in a <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.SayAs> instance.
For example, a prompt may contain the phrase "The time is `<say-as interpret-as="time"> 05:00 </say-as>`". In this example, `05:00` could be spoken as "five o'clock" or "five AM" or "oh five hundred". The <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.SayAs.Format%2A> property allows the value of the `interpret-as` attribute to be extended to specify which time format to speak. If the value for the `interpret-as` attribute is "time:24hour", the <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.SpeechSynthesizer> speaks "oh five hundred". If the value for the `interpret-as` attribute is "time:12hour", the <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.SpeechSynthesizer> speaks "five A M".

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ InterpretAs { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.InterpretAs : string with get, set

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the value of the interpret-as attribute for a say-as element in the SSML markup language of a prompt.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.FragmentState.SayAs%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property gets or sets the value for the <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.SayAs.InterpretAs%2A> property in a <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.SayAs> instance.
The <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.SpeechSynthesizer> uses the content type indicated by the <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.SayAs.InterpretAs%2A> property to determine how to render specified text.
For example, the name Edgar could be spoken as a name: "My name is Edgar". Or it could be spelled out with letters, as specified with the `interpret-as` attribute in this sentence: "My name is `<say-as interpret-as="spell-out"> Edgar </say-as>`." In this case, the <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.SpeechSynthesizer> speaks Edgar as "E D G A R".
